message_1:
Suppose you have a ciphertext that was created using a substitution cipher with the following key:

Plain alphabet:  ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ
Cipher alphabet: EQVKXGFCMZSJAWBIHNTPLODUYR

Decrypt the following message using this key:

BMSFGZ GF JHNZJX HGZBMSFGZ FISNZ YMJ CFQ TFSSJCFS:

Note: Spaces and punctuation marks are not encrypted and should be left as they are.
message_2:
To decrypt the message, we will replace each letter in the ciphertext with the corresponding letter in the plain alphabet using the given key.

Ciphertext:  BMSFGZ GF JHNZJX HGZBMSFGZ FISNZ YMJ CFQ TFSSJCFS
Plain text:  CRYPTO IS REALLY SECURE WHEN THE KEY REMAINS

The decrypted message is: "CRYPTO IS REALLY SECURE WHEN THE KEY REMAINS".
